conversationHistory.userMessage: How long can I store cooked dal?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
You can store cooked dal safely with these tips:

• Refrigerate: Store in an airtight container for up to 3-4 days.
• Freezing: Freeze in portioned containers for up to 2-3 months.
• Recipe: Use leftover dal to make dal paratha (estimated 60 BDT for ingredients).

Reducing food waste lessens environmental impact in Bangladesh.

Next step: Refrigerate your dal properly.

conversationHistory.userMessage: What's a budget meal for 5 people?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Okay, here's a budget-friendly meal plan for your family of 5:

• Main meal: Khichuri (rice and lentils) with vegetables (around 150 BDT). It’s nutritious and filling.
• Alternative: Egg curry with rice (approximately 120 BDT).

Shopping tip: Buy lentils and vegetables in bulk from local markets for better prices.

Next step: Plan your grocery shopping for the week.

conversationHistory.userMessage: How long can I store cooked dal?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Okay, here's how to store cooked dal and reduce waste:

• Refrigerate: 3-4 days in an airtight container.
• Freeze: 2-3 months in portioned containers.
• Prevent Waste: Make dal puri (estimated 70 BDT for ingredients).

Proper storage prevents food waste, reducing landfill burden in Bangladesh.

Next step: Freeze extra dal in small portions.

conversationHistory.userMessage: What's a budget meal for 5 people?
conversationHistory.botResponse:

conversationHistory.userMessage: I have leftover rice and vegetables
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Okay, here are some leftover transformation ideas:

• Main: Vegetable rice cutlets (estimated 80 BDT for flour and spices).
• Alternative: Vegetable fried rice with an egg (approximately 60 BDT).

Total cooking time: 20 minutes.

Next step: Make vegetable rice cutlets for a snack.

conversationHistory.userMessage: Vegetarian protein sources for my family?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Okay, here's how to add protein to your vegetarian meals:

• Focus: Include more protein in your family's diet.
• Options: Lentils (dal - 80 BDT/kg) are a great source, or chickpeas (chola - 90 BDT/kg).
• Importance: Protein is essential for growth and energy.

Next step: Add lentils to your next meal.

conversationHistory.userMessage: What's the environmental impact of food waste?
conversationHistory.botResponse:
Okay, here is the environmental impact:

• Landfill Burden: Food waste decomposes and creates methane, a potent greenhouse gas.
• Resource Waste: It wastes water and energy used in food production and transportation.
• Impact in Bangladesh: Reduces pressure on Dhaka's overflowing landfills.

Next step: Compost vegetable scraps to reduce landfill waste.
